metadata.Title: CVE-2012-2769 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in the topic administration page in the Extension::MobileUI extension before 1.02 for Best Practical Solutions RT 3.8.x and in Best Practical Solutions RT before 4.0.6 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2769` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

request-tracker4 - 4.0.6-3
rt4-apache2 - 4.0.6-3
rt4-clients - 4.0.6-3
rt4-db-mysql - 4.0.6-3
rt4-db-postgresql - 4.0.6-3
rt4-db-sqlite - 4.0.6-3
rt4-fcgi - 4.0.6-3
rt4-standalone - 4.0.6-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: request-tracker4 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.6-3').
